com.noisepages.nettoyeur.bluetooth

Class BluetoothSppConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.noisepages.nettoyeur.bluetooth.BluetoothSppConnection

  • public class BluetoothSppConnection
extends Object
    This class provides low-level functionality for managing a Bluetooth connection using SPP. It is intended to be used by a service that implements higher-level functionality on top of SPP, such as BluetoothMidiService.
    Author:
    Peter Brinkmann

    • Constructor Detail

      • BluetoothSppConnection

        public BluetoothSppConnection(BluetoothSppReceiver receiver,
                      int bufferSize)
                       throws IOException
        Parameters:
        receiver - a collection of callbacks for incoming Bluetooth messages as well as connection state updates
        bufferSize - buffer size for the input stream
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if Bluetooth is unavailable or disabled

        Connect to a Bluetooth device with the given MAC address, using the standard UUID for SPP.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IOException

      • connect

        public void connect(String addr,
           UUID uuid)
             throws IOException
        Connect to a Bluetooth device with the given address and UUID.
        Parameters:
        addr - string representation of MAC address of the Bluetooth device
        uuid - UUID of the Bluetooth device
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        public void write(byte[] out,
         int offset,
         int count)
           throws IOException
        Write bytes to the output stream of the SPP connection.
        Parameters:
        out - buffer containing the bytes to be sent to the Bluetooth device
        offset - index of first byte to be sent
        count - number of bytes to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException
